DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To assess whether intervention design improve social support caregiver effectively decrease caregiver burden improves quality life . Methodology : Design : Controlled , multicentre , community intervention trial , patient caregiver randomize intervention control group accord assign Primary Health Care Team ( PHCT ) . Study area : Primary Health Care network ( 9 PHCTs ) . Study participant : Primary informal caregiver patient receive home health care participate PHCTs . Sample : Required sample size 282 caregiver ( 141 PHCTs randomize intervention group 141 PHCTs randomize control group . Intervention : ) PHCT professional : standardized training implement caregiver intervention . b ) Caregivers : 1 individualized counselling session , 1 family session , 4 educational group session conduct participate PHCT professional ; addition usual home health care visit , periodic telephone follow-up contact unlimited telephone support . Control : Caregivers dependent patient : usual home health care , consist bimonthly schedule visit , follow-up need , additional attention upon request . Data Analysis . Dependent variable : Caregiver burden ( short-form Zarit test ) , caregiver social support ( Medical Outcomes Study ) , caregiver report quality life ( SF-12 ) Independent variable : ) Caregiver : sociodemographic data , Goldberg Scale , Apgar family questionnaire , Holmes Rahe Psychosocial Stress Scale , number chronic disease . b ) Dependent patient : sociodemographic data , level dependency ( Barthel Index ) , cognitive impairment ( Pfeiffer test ) Discussion : If intervention intend improve social family support effective reduce burden primary informal caregiver dependent patient , model readily apply throughout usual PHCT clinical practice .
